channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: The historic US shutdown is over. But why is nobody celebrating?
Tracing Donald Trump and Jeffrey Epstein's long, complicated relationship
Why Japan PM Takaichi is under fire over a '3 am meeting'
Flights halted, police escorts: How seriously South Korea takes its college exam
Is Asim Munir the de facto ruler of Pakistan after 27th Amendment passes?
i20, Brezza, EcoSport and more… How multiple vehicles are ‘linked’ to Delhi blast
If unchecked, Yunus’s Bangladesh risks sliding into Islamic absolutism
item.description: A Bangladesh transformed into an Islamist fundamentalist state would unravel decades of progress toward regional integration, counterterrorism and maritime security

item.title: Faridabad module and New Delhi blast: Some answers but a lot more uncomfortable questions stare at India
item.description: The New Delhi blast and the Faridabad terror module indicate an uncomfortable time for India in terms of internal stability and regional security matrix. The Indian leadership must weigh its options.

item.title: PM Modi’s Bhutan visit despite Delhi blast shows India will not be deterred by terrorists
item.description: If Pakistan is using terror machinery to obstruct India’s normal course of diplomacy, then with PM Modi’s Bhutan visit, India has just proved that it will not be deterred by terrorists

item.title: Delhi blast underscores India’s escalating terror threat despite security gains
item.description: India can no longer just ‘mow the lawn’ against terrorism. It’s time for the country to change the rules of the counterterror game.

item.title: Rich kid socialism or rising progressive force? The case of Zohran Mamdani
item.description: The future of Mamdani’s experiment depends on whether he can convert generational energy into institutional outcomes

item.title: Tatsuya Nakadai: A farewell to the last great samurai of Japanese cinema
item.description: With Tatsuya Nakadai’s passing, we lose not only a master actor but also a bridge between eras of cinema — a link from the black-and-white samurai epic to the colour horizontals of modernity.
